title: Never Let Me Go
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
blurb: From the Booker Prize-winning author of The Remains of the Day comes a devastating new novel of innocence, knowledge, and loss. As children Kathy, Ruth, and Tommy were students at Hailsham, an exclusive boarding school secluded in the English countryside. It was a place of mercurial cliques and mysterious rules where teachers were constantly reminding their charges of how special they were.
comments: Maddie: Ah I've been wanting to read this book for so long, Jenn: What a devastating book...

title: Eleanor & Park
author: Rainbow Rowell
blurb: An astounding award-winning novel and international bestseller: New-in-town Eleanor bonds with the boy she sits beside on the bus every day. “Reminded me not just what it’s like to be young and in love with a girl, but also what it’s like to be young and in love with a book” (John Green).
comments: Ana: I actually adore this book

title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
author: Stephen Chbosky
blurb: In the tradition of The Catcher in the Rye and A Separate Peace, a powerful novel about the wild days of growing up.

title: Looking for Alaska
author: John Green
blurb: From the beloved author of The Fault in Our Stars and Paper Towns: When Miles heads off to boarding school, he opens his mind and heart to a magnetic girl named Alaska. An unforgettable New York Times bestseller exploring the heartache and beauty of coming of age.
